Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the effectiveness of the listed treatments for COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or scientific support for the effectiveness of the listed treatments.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the listed treatments are accurate and applicable to COVID-19 without providing reliable sources or expert opinions.
Exist alternative explanation: Health experts and organizations provide alternative explanations and refute the claims made in the photo.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no proven treatment for COVID-19 exists as stated by international health authorities.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in terms of biases.
